intro: Cyclophorus taeniodes, commonly known as the slender cyclophorus, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy flowers. The plant typically features lance-shaped leaves and produces small, tubular flowers in shades of red, pink, or purple. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shrubland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercialized.
